Articles.Content: This Airshipartwork is real real amazing.@Westi29

Maybe some copper external fuel lines to transfer water, whale oil, and oxidizer into the boilers and such? Or even just copper external fuel lines so we can do steampunk asparagus staging. Also I am sure bigger capsules and water tanks will be coming in the future? Last comment and it is purely for people who dont like to play around. Me I like love playing around figuring out how to make the various tanks, engines, and goodies to work some people really might get frustrated not knowing how to get rockets off the ground immediately. So better definitions of how to put the parts together in the descriptions or craft files so people can see how things work. That all being said once again this is truly a fabulous and refreshing mod. Its also beautifully made and well thought out. The biggest of high fives to you.

I am still trying to figure out fuel lines and struts, that burning smell is my brain frying:wink:

I have an extremely basic tutorial on the forum page, however i could probably fit more in the part descriptions, I will put it into motion.

I've flown it now, and I must say, it is a most splendid mod. Tesla stuff and science stuff would be awesome too One thing though. The mod is great so far, but since it is steampunk, I think you should make more things out of brass and copper, not just wooden barrels. Reminds me of the wacky wood wares mod a little too much, to be honest.

I've flown it now, and I must say, it is a most splendid mod. Tesla stuff and science stuff would be awesome too One thing though. The mod is great so far, but since it is steampunk, I think you should make more things out of brass and copper, not just wooden barrels. Reminds me of the wacky wood wares mod a little too much, to be honest.

As parts get larger and further up the tech tree they will become more industrial looking ( more metal, less wood )

On struts....

I believe you can save yourself some work there, at least on the struts. The mod already requires Firespitter so anybody playing this mod will have the Firespitter biplane struts available in their game. That's what I use for struts on steampunk rockets. There are 2 types of biplane struts in Firespitter that function just like stock struts. However, instead of looking like metal bars, 1 type looks like a varnished 1x8 board and the other looks like piano wire.

On the fuel lines, all you really need there is to retexture the stock one to make it look appropriately Victorian.

Anyone know what that rising-electricity-device is called? That would be perfect for an antenna.

If you mean this, that's called a Jacob's Ladder.

Other Frankenstein-type lab equipment include:

Wimshurst Generators

Van de Graaff Generators

Lord Kelvin's Thunderstorm

Tesla Coil

The main drawback to such things is that AFAIK they require an atmosphere to throw sparks via ionizing air molecules. I have no idea if they'd arc in space. So they might be more appropriate in IVA views like in the Mobile Lab. HOWEVER, this is a mod that pokes reality square in the eye so....

so much copper.... need other metals, time for new stuff

Maybe you could do an oxidized copper or brass look? You know like hues of green to make it go with the the steampunk and kerbal theme of the parts just being found.

To the science point i mean retexturing the current stuff like you did with mechjeb should be fine, if it saves you time and heartache. I mean The mystery goo container seems ripe for a retexture into something whimsical and steampunky. Maybe use the textures you used to make the acid battery and just take one of those cylinders out with the green stuff and make that the mystery goo. Also to that point you could easily convert the acid battery by changing some of the textures and colors and maki ti into a new materials bay (sc-9001 jr.). Like purple yellow red, blue, and when the study is done they turn black.
